content: CPF Investments Retirement Supplementary Retirement Scheme (SRS) Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 Sep 2019For an SRS account opened with DBS, there will be a charge of $50 if the balance is below $200k?Start A Supplementary Retirement Scheme (SRS) Account With Just $1. But for an SRS account opened with DBS, there will be a charge of $50 if the balance is below $200k? How is this a hack?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 22 Sep 2019That's impossible. There are no fees on the SRS account. The maximum contribution per year is 15.3k also. How is it possible that they'll charge $50 every year for 15 years?And it says it right here https://www.dbs.com.sg/iwov-resources/pdf/invest/supplementary-retirement-scheme/srs_schedule_of_charges.pdf"All other SRS charges are currently waived by the Bank until further notice"3 comments4

See all 3 comments Hariz Arthur Maloy22 Sep 2019That's only for treasures clients. And it says $200,000 includes worth in deposits and assets managed under all those account you have. The fee doesn't apply to your SRS account.Question Poster23 Sep 2019Thank You!
